text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Game Boy Color (as it was known globally) was created in 1989 by Nintendo is the portable handheld console succeeding the Game Boy. It incorporates a color screen similar in size to the Game Boy, but has an improved 8MHz processor, 32KB of RAM, 16KB of video memory and a resolution of 160x144 in 56 colors. It is backwards compatible with most first generation Game Boy games and has a 10 hour battery life. Upon launch its case was available in 6 different colors with more special edition colors being released in the future.
